info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 7:10PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN HUNTINGDON... SOUTHWESTERN CENTRE...NORTHEASTERN BLAIR AND NORTHEASTERN CAMBRIA COUNTIES THROUGH 745 PM EDT... At 709 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Altoona, moving northeast at 10 mph. Other strong storms were nearby. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Altoona, Tyrone, Bellwood, Tipton, Blandburg, Birmingham, Sinking Valley, Canoe Creek State Park, Delgrosso`s Amusement Park and Penn State Altoona. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Very heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
